uk.ac.cam.darknet.common

Class Individual

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.cam.darknet.common.Individual

  • public class Individual
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for storing a person with their data. The common attribute types that are provided by the primary data collectors are available as getters. All the data coming from secondary collectors is stored in a Properties object that belongs to the individual. Note that each attribute type available is prefixed with the unique ID of the corresponding collector to avoid name clashes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Individual

        public Individual(long id,
          java.lang.String firstName,
          java.lang.String lastName,
          java.lang.String email,
          java.util.Date eventDate,
          java.lang.String seat,
          java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,AttributeCategories> globalAttributeTable)
        Creates a new individual. The parameters should match the corresponding fields in the primary table of the database. This constructor should only be used by the database manager. Only the first and last names are required. The remaining fields may be null.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique ID for the individual. This should be equal to the individual's primary key in the database.
        firstName - The individual's first name.
        lastName - The individual's last name.
        email - The individual's email, if any.
        eventDate - The date of the event the ticket was booked for, if any.
        seat - The reserved seat of the booking, if any.
        globalAttributeTable - The global table mapping all available attribute names to their global attribute types.

    • Method Detail

      • getNewIndividual

        public static Individual getNewIndividual(java.lang.String firstName,
                          java.lang.String lastName,
                          java.lang.String email,
                          java.util.Date eventDate,
                          java.lang.String seat,
                          java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,AttributeCategories> globalAttributeTable)
        This method should be used by primary data collectors to obtain a new individual (with a default ID) that has to be added to the database. They should not use the constructor for this purpose. The database manager will automatically assign an ID to the new individual when storing it in the database. Only the first and last names are required. The remaining fields may be null.
        Parameters:
        firstName - The first name of the new individual.
        lastName - The last name of the new individual.
        email - The email address of the new individual, expressed as a string.
        eventDate - The date and time of the event the individual booked.
        seat - The seat number of the individual booked, if any.
        globalAttributeTable - The global attribute table in the system.
        Returns:
        An individual suitable to be passed to PrimaryDatabaseManager.store() for storage into the database.

      • getId

        public long getId()
        Get the unique ID of this individual. This should be equal to its primary key in the database.
        Returns:
        Returns the unique user ID of the individual.

      • getEventDate

        public java.util.Date getEventDate()
        Get the date of the show the individual is attending.
        Returns:
        The date of the event for which this individual is bought a ticket.

      • getSeat

        public java.lang.String getSeat()
        Get the reserved seat of the individual's booking, if any.
        Returns:
        The booked seat, if any, as a string. Null otherwise.

      • getProperties

        public Properties getProperties()
        This method returns the individual's Properties object. The exact attributes contained within depends on what the effect using this individual has requested.
        Returns:
        The Properties object holding attributes about the individual.
